clinical_study.official_title: Study on Fluid Optimization in Liver Surgery Trough Vigileo/FloTac System Associated to Traditional Monitoring.

lead_sponsor.agency: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

clinical_study.source: Catholic University of the Sacred Heart

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to analyze hemodynamic changes, in patients undergoing liver resection, through the Vigileo/FloTrac system.

detailed_description.textblock:
To reduce bleeding, hepatectomies are performed with low central pressure (CVP) combined with extrahepatic control flow.
This management can lead hemodynamic instability and reduction in oxygen delivery so an advanced monitoring should be used.
This study analyzes hemodynamic changes, in patients undergoing liver resection, through the Vigileo/FloTrac system.

primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of changes in Stroke Volume Variation from Vigileo/FloTrac system during liver resection.

secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of changes in Stroke Volume Variation at the end of liver resection, during fluid optimization.

study_pop.textblock: In this study were enrolled patients scheduled for elective major hepatic surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I-III
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cirrhosis
- systolic ventricular contractility or diastolic relaxation alterations
- ischemic or valvular diseases
- absence of sinusal rhythm
- impaired renal function
